description: The crash occurred at a T-intersection on an eastbound/westbound roadway. V1 was traveling westbound on a five-lane (two westbound and two eastbound with a center turn lane) undivided roadway. V2 was traveling on a two-lane (one northbound and one southbound) undivided roadway. Both asphalt roadways were dry, level, and there were no adverse weather conditions. The posted speed limit for both roadways was 40 kmph (25mph). The crash occurred in the early afternoon hours on a weekday. Traffic was heavy on the east/westbound roadway. V1, a 4-door 1999 Nissan Altima, was traveling westbound in lane #1 when it struck with its front end the left side of V2, a 4-door 1987 Buick Lesabre. V2 had been southbound on the intersecting roadway, and was attempting a left turn at the T-intersection. V2 had a stop sign posted at the corner of the T-intersection and had stopped before initiating its turn. According to the interview, the driver of V2 was attempting to merge into the oncoming traffic and didn't see the vehicle coming from her left. The driver of V1, a 39-year old male, stated that there was a curve several feet before the intersection and it took away his ability to see V2 crossing in front of him. The driver of V1 was familiar with the roadway - he drove on it daily. The driver of V1 was not injured. V1 was not towed.

The crash occurred in the early afternoon of a weekday in the westbound lanes of a divided two-way roadway with three lanes in each direction.  The roadway was straight and level and had a posted speed limit of 48kmph (30mph).  It was daylight and clear with no adverse conditions.V1, a 1997 Infiniti QX4, was traveling westbound in the right lane (lane one).  V2, a 1990 Ford Crown Victoria, was traveling westbound on the middle lane (lane two).  V2 attempted to make a right turn at the intersection the right side of his vehicle collided with the left front of V1.  V1 then went off the roadway to the right and then the front impacted a breakaway light pole.V1 was driven by a 34 year-old female who sustained minor injuries and was transported to a medical facility.  She was unable to be located for an interview, but she told the police on scene that she was going straight when V2 attempted to make a right turn at the intersection.  The Infiniti was towed due to damage.
